> [kopyjane](#comment_56_17ffrcHNzbFoUe81PyMEagQdv2DGNRLFcE): In my years of research, I've come up with hundreds of articles describing all sorts of deficiencies linked to depression. If it's not a lack of Vitamin B12, it's a lack of Tyrosine, if it's not a lack of Tyrosine, it's a lack of iron.. if it's not a lack of iron, it's a lack of sleep.. if it's not a lack of sleep, it's too much sleep... if it's not a lack of social contact, it's too much social contact.. etc. It shouldn't be a rocket science. Just make sure you're eating a balanced diet, exercising, drinking water, avoiding drug abuse, sleeping right.. socializing.. etc. Try not to do supplements unless you have an actual deficiency diagnosed by a doctor. Of course, all of this is easier said than done, especially in this day and age.. so maybe it's time we also looked at the bigger picture and start doing something about the society we live in; the environment.
